definition: Li Ning (1963-), PRC gymnast, winner of three gold medals at Los Angeles 1984 Olympic games
abbr. for Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region 寧夏回族自治區|宁夏回族自治区[Ning2 xia4 Hui2 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 qu1]/abbr. for Nanjing 南京[Nan2 jing1]/surname Ning

sentences.english: Those boys dressed themselves in Li Ning tracksuits immediately.
sentences.chinese: 那些男生都立即穿上了李宁牌运动服。

sentences.english: Mr. Guo and the other Li-Ning executives have big plans for Li-Ning sneakers.
sentences.chinese: 郭先生和李宁的高管们对这个品牌有着宏大的计划。

sentences.english: Those rooms are Wang Yong and Li Ning's.
sentences.chinese: 这些是王勇和李宁共有的房间。

sentences.english: Li Ning currently sponsors China's national badminton team and several tournaments in the country.
sentences.chinese: 李宁目前在中国赞助中国国家羽毛球队和几项赛事。

sentences.english: Li-Ning has spared no effort to fulfill this mission.
sentences.chinese: 李宁公司从不放弃任何努力以实现这一使命。

sentences.english: Take sports-apparel maker Li Ning as an example.
sentences.chinese: 以体育服装制造商李宁公司为例。

sentences.english: Lilin gained the first medal for China in men's gymnastics contest.
sentences.chinese: 李宁在男子体操比赛中为中国获得第一块金牌。

sentences.english: Li Ning found himself a different way to be with his beloved sports.
sentences.chinese: 李宁找到了支持他曾经热爱的体育事业的另一条道路。

sentences.english: Li ning won the first gold medal in men's gymnastic for china.
sentences.chinese: 李宁在男子体操比赛中为中国获得第一块金牌。

sentences.english: But when it comes to United States consumers, Li-Ning is almost a total unknown.
sentences.chinese: 但在美国消费者看来，李宁是一家完全不知名的公司。

sentences.english: Its chief executive, Qin Dazhong, was also previously at Li Ning.
sentences.chinese: 公司首席执行长秦大中之前也曾在李宁公司供职。

sentences.english: Li Ning currently sponsors Dhina's national badminton team and several tournaments in the country.
sentences.chinese: 李宁目前在神州赞助神州国家羽毛球队和几项赛事。

sentences.english: Li Ning, a teacher of English teaching volunteers, also give specific guidance.
sentences.chinese: 李宁老师对志愿者的英语教学给予了具体指导。

definition: Liu Xiang (1983-), Chinese gold-medal hurdler of the 2004 Olympic Games
Li Na (1982-), Chinese tennis player, first Asian player to win a Grand Slam singles title (2011 French Open women's singles)
to right a wrong/to redress an injustice
Deng Yaping (1973-), table tennis player, several times world and Olympic winner
Xu Haifeng (1957-), PRC sharpshooter, 50m pistol gold medalist at Los Angeles 1984 Olympics
abbr. for 奧林匹克運動會|奥林匹克运动会/Olympic Games/the Olympics
Yang Wei (1979-), PRC badminton player, women's doubles specialist
Wang Nan (1978-), female PRC table tennis player, Olympic medalist
Qiao Hong (1968-), former PRC female table tennis player
surname Zou/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC) in the southeast of Shandong Province
